author: treasury.guild
title: Catalyst Treasury Guild
description: Emerging Projects within Catalyst need professional accountant and treasury services from a neutral body/party.

f6_assessments.q0: proposer has provided quite specific information regarding the solution. First, the proposer introduced specifically the audit services provided, then, stated how this solution affects Cardano. Proposer also shows voters the progress of work/projects on Github/Gitbook. In addition, the solution also provides additional risks that the project may face when released.
f6_assessments.q1: The new Proposer gives an outline for the work, not a detailed roadmap. Proposer should provide more information related to the project to get a more specific roadmap. Likewise, the information section of the 'detailed budget breakdown' should include additional information such as activities in the Pr and marketing section. Profiles of team members have been updated via linkedin link, however, the proposer can provide general information related to positions in the group directly in the proposal as well as the information of partner groups.
f6_assessments.q2: The project objectives are provided quite well, the information related to the development of the project is updated through reputable 3rd parties such as Github and Gitbook. This is a plus for project transparency. However, if the proposer can provide additional target numbers such as the number of customers, the proposer will be more rigorous.

f6_assessments.q0: According to my understanding, the project's major goal is to assist Catalyst Circle's treasury with three key functions: Treasury Management, Accounting Services, and Dapps & Integrations. With these characteristics, the service will substantially aid in transparent and straightforward financial management. But that's all I can see in this part. As for the proposed solution addressing the challenge, I didn't find any useful information or match the requirements of this section. Proposer just once again outlines the features of the service without going into the focus on the requirement of this section which is what it will achieve. In addition, predicting only 1 challenge in the near future makes the project vulnerable to stalling if unexpected circumstances arise. Even the proposer is unable to identify an appropriate remedy for that risk, which will cause the project to face further challenges in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: My satisfaction with this part can be maximized because I can see all the required data appear here. Proposer not only gives a plan for phase 1 of fund 8 but also includes phase 2 of fund 9, giving experts and investors a more comprehensive view of the project's progress. In addition, how the project intends to spend the money is also provided in great detail. Even the team members are carefully selected to fit the project. And I also don't want to change anything in this section.
f6_assessments.q2: Instead of just stating a general, the proposer can use a certain amount or approximate a range for the progress and development portion of the project. Besides, I don't see a specific timeline in this section, so the proposer should review what was mentioned in the previous part to give the most appropriate and accurate timelines. In the end, for the successes they calculate, it is generally quite good and reasonable. In addition, the proposer also emphasized with the staff and the outlined plan will provide effective solutions, tools, and services to the Cardano Community, helping investors once again see the great benefits it brings to the ecosystem. But perhaps, adding more will help the project be deployed sooner.

f6_assessments.q0:
This project addresses very important topics of the challenge since it will allow teams behind Catalyst funded projects to spend more time on what they do and almost no time on handling the accounting and getting the funds from the treasury, and all that with full transparency for the Cardano community. 
Also, it wants to bring together experts to develop tools and daps for automation of the process on the blockchain, creating a valuable asset for growing a sustainable ecosystem. 

The community will have a better insight into the business of projects, transactions and how the money is spent. Independent treasury management adds more transparency to the community and full insight in how the funds are spend. 

The project fits in to all three key metrics of the challenge and the proposal itself is made to be scalable and ready for future challenges of a growing Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team behind the project is active in handling accountant and treasury assignments for 4 Catalyst Circle projects already which is the evidence for their skills and experience needed to implement the proposal.
The team cooperates with many successful Cardano projects and teams which speaks for their engagement in the project and Cardano community itself.

The plan is precise, well elaborated and put in to realistic timetable within a bigger picture (the plan to run for fund 9). It is reasonable to expect from this team to make a successful project if given the funds because of their insider, hands on experience and the Cardano teams they collaborate with. 

Budget seems realistic and well planned for scalability and successful future development of the project. The Budget is well broken down and transparent.
f6_assessments.q2:
The entire proposal is very clear and to the point with measurable goals and KPIs. It has a detailed and well explained Timetable with trackable and measurable Milestones.

Solution that they offer is well explained and understandable and it addresses the problem well. The team offers that same solution (their accounting and treasury services) as a guarantee for auditability and totally transparent budget allocations and distribution through their Github repositories and Gitbook.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal sets out the clear a problem connects with the needs of the challenge especially with the solution which aims  the creation of tailor made solutions for Catalyst Projects and thus the sharing of an expertise and a professional knowledge from the community for the community. The added value of this proposal is clearly explained and conscious. In particular in its desire to “add more transparency by having independent treasury management” and to bring “better insight into the business of projects, transactions and how the money is spent”.
The KPIs are well linked to those of the challenge and this is explained in a clear and precise way: “offers services and tools to the community” “explore and establish a decentralized ecosystem and environment”. The explanation of the different development phases of the project shows us that this proposal will be able to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1:
The members of this team are easily identifiable and a link to their profile is given as proof. It would have been nice to briefly explain their different roles in the community and their experiences, to save the reader some time. 
The number of their collaboration is an additional index of their network within the ecosystem and the support necessary to implement their will. The budget is well detailed and seems consistent with the needs of the project. As well as the plan with its different phases and its provision for the additional funds required is specified. 
The fact that this project is a direct extension of the Catalyst Circle Treasury Management Proposal (with the link provided) is an indication of continuity and shows the team's long-term commitment. 
Risks are addressed with a solution that will benefit the community and thus add value to the overall impact.
f6_assessments.q2: The team explains the ability to track their progress through their “Established and vibrant Gitbook and Github actions and automations” and that they are in the process of building their website, stating that they  “aim to offer and guarantee full access to our budget allocations and distributions”. This is consistent with the KPIs of the challenge, as well as their desire to contribute to the Ecosystem in becoming a fully decentralized and autonomous Communit. It seems that this auditability effort is a very important element of this proposal and claimed by the team. “our actions and operations will be fully transparent, tracked, documented and displayed”.

solution: Establishing the Treasury Guild, an Assembly of professional accountants, creating tailor made solutions for Catalyst Projects.
experience: We started to form our group as Catalyst Circle Admin Treasurers in Fund 6. We support Catalyst Circle in its functionality. Due to our Experience and Engagement with the Catalyst Circle, we now feel ready to establish a fully independent and neutral Accountant & Treasury Guild
